p: Before anastomosis, the tissues around the vascular stump should be fully freed to reduce the tension of the vascular stumps. To extend the length of the gastric conduit and to reduce the tension of esophageal anastomosis, the fundus of stomach should not be clipped during the gastric conduit construction until cervical anastomosis was completed ( Figure 2C), while the adhesions surrounding the gastric conduit should be dissected sufficiently and cautiously.
